page.title: 08VILLAGE HALL
page.content: The community life of each of the villages is centred around their village halls. These halls were built just after the last war and are made of concrete with asbestos roofs.They are run by small dedicated and hard working committees who raise funds to maintain the halls. Morland hall is used by,Woman's Institute,Youth Club,Girl Guides,Over Sixty's,Playgroup,Keep Fit group, and the Parish Council.It is used regularly for sales, coffee mornings,whist and dominoe drives,concerts, films,dances,and private parties such as birthdays, christening, wedding and funeral celebrations. The halls play a large and important part in the social and community life of the villages.All this for Â£3 p/hour.
